page.title: 06Sheep farming.
page.content: We visited a sheep farmer.He farms 35O acres, and has 2l7O sheep. They are Border Leicesters and Mules. The sheep feed on grass in the summer and the lambs feed on creep which is barley and flaked wheat. The ewes get a lot of illnesses; black udder, fluke, stomach worms and twin lamb disease. Lambs can have sway back if they are not treated. Scab is the major disease; sheep have to be dipped twice annually. The farm has shifts during lambing. The lambs are kept for about l6 to 2O weeks, and the ewes for 5 years. There are two sheep dogs, Archie, aged 7 and Flash who is 2 years old. At shearing time, four men shear twenty five sheep each in one hour. The farmer goes to market to buy and sell sheep.
